intro: Corispermum declinatum, commonly known as the leaning bladderwrath, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is adapted to cold climates. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Corispermum declinatum plays a role in stabilizing soil in its harsh environment and is of interest to botanists studying plant adaptation.
